reviews.text: We are not persons to typically stay in chain hotels but found this as the top rated place to stay in our short trip to Payson, Arizona. It was really a great experience. Clean rooms, friendly staff, a workout facility, a nice clean pool, and coffee and continental breakfast. It was walkable (across the street) from a nice coffeehouse and a GREAT no frill Mexican Rest. called La Sierra (highly recommended...order off their house specials list...incredibly authentic).
reviews.title: Best place to stay in Payson

reviews.text: We chose this hotel for it's location. It is at the north end of town which is less congested. The grounds have alot of grass and mature trees and each room has a balcony or patio with chairs so you can relax outside your room and watch the birds. The hotel room was very large with nice furnishings and comforatable beds. It would have been nice to have an elevator to get to the second floor. The continental breakfast was very good with a friendly hostess. The dining room was restaurant style with quiet comfortable booths. A Mexican restaurant is across the street that is quaint and ..oh..so good!

reviews.text: On a 2 month roadtrip and have been staying mostly at Motel 6 (travelling with pet and hate the rip-off charges some companies have). This place was a nice change and we felt like we could walk on the carpet without having to wear our shoes. Room was clean and comfy and area was quiet and handy. Just down the road from a Wal-Mart Supercenter !!! Paid $80 for the night not including taxes - for a king room - no fridge. I would stay here again.

Not as advertised
reviews.text: I recently made a reservation for my daughter and her friend for 2 days, 11/24 and 11/25, for Thanksgiving.

I was disappointed in the room that she was assigned, even though the price was reasonable. Before making the reservation through Expedia, I called the Best Western in Payson to ask about the difference in the rooms according to the rate. I was told that there was not a difference. When she arrived late in the afternoon we asked to see the room and was told that it was not ready, it was still being cleaned. They called in the middle of dinner to say that the room was ready, but she waited until later to register so didn't see the room until then. The bath towels were very small and not in good condition, plus they were given only two. Also, only one bar of soap was in the room for the hand basin and shower. I advised her to talk to the manager, but she said at least the bed was clean.
reviews.title: Perfect Location for Last Minute Stay!

reviews.text: Needless to say, I was very disappointed and will never use the Payson Inn again.

reviews.title: A pleasant surprise
reviews.text: My husband and I decided to take a "day" trip to Payson from Tucson, Arizona. After arriving and looking around, we decided to stay the night, if there were any hotels available. Much to our surprise and delight, the Best Western had a room available for us for a very reasonable price. And the central location was just perfect with a view of the Rim. The room was very spacious and clean and check in and out was smooth. We will visit again!

My husband and I stayed here in February, 2005. We had been traveling in Arizona, and were looking for a place to stay after leaving the Painted Desert/Petrified Forest area on our way to Phoenix. We were pleasantly surprised by the Best Western in Payson. We only paid about $55/night with a AAA discount. The room was spacious with a walk in closet, table and chairs, small refrigerator and microwave. We liked the western type decor of the room. We also enjoyed the landscaping. I agree with another rater that the area for the continental breakfast was very large, comfortable and pleasant. The scenery in the area was beautiful as was the drive to Phoenix from Payson. We ate dinner at an Italian restaurant that was just down the street closer to a major intersection. The food there was good. We would definitely stay at the Best Western in Payson again.
reviews.title: Average, but very good experience
